name: premeditatedly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If a crime or bad act is committed premeditatedly, it is done after being thought about or carefully planned: The song is about a woman who premeditatedly murders her unfaithful husband. They were in effect telling their readers to premeditatedly break the law.
More examplesFewer examplesThis book is completely, and premeditatedly, different from anything its author has done before.Self-defence could be a reasonable claim, even if you are carrying a weapon premeditatedly.Civilians were being consciously and premeditatedly killed.
